textBeforeTable: Required Courses To complete the degree, students must complete 36 credits: 15 credits by taking required courses and 21 credits by taking elective courses. Degree Requirements MTH 9875 The Volatility Surface MTH 9865 Commodities and Futures Trading Fall 2010: MTH 9882 Fixed Income Risk Management Fall 2011: MTH 9868 Advanced Risk and Portfolio Management Summer 2011: MTH 9894 Algorithmic Trading MTH 9893 Time Series Analysis MTH 9879 Market Microstructure Models Spring 2011: MTH 9896 Behavioral Finance MTH 9883 Structured Security Valuation in the Primary Market Fall 2012: MTH 9891 Introduction to Financial Econometrics Winter 2012: MTH 9863 Volatility Filtering and Estimation Spring 2013: MTH 9876 Credit Risk Models Fall 2014: MTH 9899 Data Science II: Machine Learning MTH 9898 Data Science I: Big Data in Finance MTH 9878 Interest Rate Models Spring 2015: MTH 9855 Asset Allocation and Portfolio Management Fall 2015: Sixteen new elective courses introduced since 2010: Cutting Edge Curriculum The number of required credits was reduced from 21 to 15, and the number of elective credits increased from 15 to 21. Flexible Curriculum The new Baruch MFE Curriculum is cutting edge (sixteen new courses taught by top practitioners introduced since Fall 2010), flexible (fewer required credits and newly introduced half-semester courses), and streamlined (a core set of redesigned courses). After an extensive review which included feedback from industry practitioners, alumni, and faculty, the Baruch MFE Curriculum was reshaped to best fit the current financial employment environment.
